== Main Inclusion Report for mono-debugger ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/m/mono-debugger]]</nowiki>; available for i386 and AMD64 - probably works on LPIA too, can add to list of architectures in Debian package if confirmed ?
# ''Rationale:''
** Enables debugging of Mono-based apps & libraries (e.g. F-Spot, Tomboy, both in Main)
0. ''Security:''
** No CVE entries
** No Secunia advisories
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.  No daemons
** No Network activity
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data - uses "Mono.Cecil" library to parse Mono libs/executables
** No source code review performed.
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package works out of the box
** No debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:mono-debugger|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: No Debian bugs
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/m/mono-debugger.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is performed by active team collaboration
** <nowiki>[[http://www.mono-project.com/Debugger|Upstream]]</nowiki> is active (mono-debugger is now updated in tandem with the rest of the Mono stack)
** <nowiki>[[https://bugzilla.novell.com/buglist.cgi?product=Mono%3A+Debugger&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED&order=bugs.bug_id|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: Seems there may be a bug on recent kernels (423518) causing issues
** Does not deal with hardware
** No test suite
0. ''UI standards:''
** Not internationalized (very few text strings)
** Command-line app (no .desktop)
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant.
** <nowiki>[[http://pkg-mono.alioth.debian.org/cli-policy/|Debian CLI Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system: Debhelper (v5)
0. ''Dependencies:''
** libc6, libglib2.0-0, libmono-corlib2.0-cil, libmono-getoptions2.0-cil, libmono-system2.0-cil, libmono0, libmono1.0-cil, libncurses5, mono-runtime
** All in Main
** Dependency on libmono1.0-cil may be replaced by a new package during Jaunty development window (to help save disk space unnecessarily consumed by libmono1.0-cil dependencies)
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Relatively small package, little work needed on a given release (but will need coaxing by a Mono-experienced developer for new upstream releases)
** Team maintained by pkg-mono in Alioth (pkg-mono and pkg-cli-* contributors include several DDs and Ubuntu Developers)
